intro: Ruellia sellowiana, commonly known as Brazilian plume or blue plume, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Ruellia sellowiana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
